title: useEffect Hook
description: useEffect lets you perform side effects in functional components. It runs after render and can optionally clean up after itself.
explanation:
useEffect is React's hook for handling side effects - operations that interact with the outside world like data fetching, subscriptions, or manually changing the DOM.

Key concepts:
- Runs after every render by default
- Dependency array controls when it runs
- Return function for cleanup
- Replaces componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate, componentWillUnmount

Dependency array patterns:
- [] = Run once on mount
- [dep1, dep2] = Run when dependencies change
- No array = Run after every render

Common mistakes to avoid:
- Missing dependencies (use ESLint plugin)
- Not cleaning up subscriptions
- Infinite loops from state updates
- Using async directly in useEffect
useCase: API calls, subscriptions, timers, event listeners, DOM manipulation, local storage sync
